docstring.long_description: The TextBlob can be recognized as an optional input to the LOCAL_FILE node, which can then load the file at that path and return the appropriate datatype.
docstring.short_description: Blob match a pattern in the given input directory, iterate (in a LOOP) over all of the files found, then return each file path as a TextBlob.

parameters.name: current_iteration
parameters.description:
This is the input from the LOOP_INDEX node that determines
whether we need to initialize this routine or not.

parameters.name: default_params
parameters.description:
This provides the node_id so that we can identify which
object in SmallMemory to pull (for example, unique identification
of this node if there are multiple BATCH_PROCESSOR nodes).

parameters.name: directory_path
parameters.description: The directory in which we should match the pattern to find the files.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description:
The glob pattern to match.
If not provided, all files in the directory are returned.
The current implementation supports recursion and double wildcard matching.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
A switching parameter that refreshes the cache of files. If a separate
programme is expected to continuously write new files of interest to the
directory, this flag will enable the update of the new files for processing.

returns.name: fname
returns.description: The file name on the current iteration.

returns.name: n_files
returns.description: The total number of files matched by the pattern in the given directory.
